STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 6, 2025
Kyle Rambo
CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES OF THE UPPER PENINSU
427 S STEPHENSON AVE STE 215, Suite 215
IRON MOUNTAIN, MI, 49801-3458
RE: License#: CB220201016
Dear Mr. Rambo:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 05/05/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI 49684
231-409-7714
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12203 Financial stability
• (1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient
financing, on an ongoing basis, to ensure the
agency is carrying out its programs and meeting
the requirements for licensing. A plan of
financing must include all the following:
• (e) An audit of all financial accounts
conducted annually by an independent
certified public accountant not
administratively related to the agency. A
copy of the audit shall be available to the
department upon request.
The agency has not had a certified public accountant audit for the year 2024.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:

• (b) Verification that the foster parent is
willing to accept the foster child.
One of one borrowed bed files reviewed did not document that the foster parent
was willing to accept the child for placement.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (c) The initial evaluation and current
reevaluation.
One of one borrowed bed files reviewed did contain the initial and current
evaluations.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (e) Verification of all children currently
placed in the home.
One of one borrowed bed files reviewed did not contain a list of children currently
placed in the home.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (f) Documentation that the foster parent
has received orientation to the policies of
the borrowing agency.

One of one borrowed bed files reviewed did not document that the foster parent
received orientation to agency policies.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency the borrowing
agency shall have a record containing all the
following:
• (g) A copy of the foster parent /agency
agreement signed by the foster parent
and the borrowing agency.
One of one borrowed bed files reviewed did not document a signed
parent/agency agreement.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (1) An agency shall develop service plans with
the child, the child's parents or legal guardian,
the referring agency, and other parties involved
in providing needed services, or medical care,
unless the agency documents why any of the
entities have not been involved.
One of three files reviewed contained a PATP that was not signed/reviewed by
the caregiver.
REPEAT VOLATION:
Interim 04/12/2024, CAP Approved 10/03/2024
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Technical assistance was provided in the following area. The agency was
informed that DCWL is no longer auditing for any DHHS policy.

V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows: The agency
submitted an approved CAP on 10/03/2024 in response to violations established
during the Interim Inspection completed on 04/12/2024. The CAP was successful
in preventing repeat violations of Rule 400.12212 (d), (h), Personal Records.
There was one repeat violation established under R 400.12418 (1), Development
of Service Plans as there was a PATP that lacked signatures. During the 2024
audit the lack of signatures on PATP's was cited under FOM 722-08D Treatment
Plans.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was reviewed. The assessment addressed
barriers such as staff turnover, and difficulty in recruiting new staff. The
assessment also addressed the problem of retention of workers. The assessment
addressed the additional problem of servicing a large geographical, rural area in
the UP. The agency has reduced caseload size to assist workers in fulfilling job
requirements. The assessment also addressed the agency CAP and its
implementation from the 2024 audit.
Financial Overview
The agency submitted a budget for 2025. There were no concerns noted. The
agency did not have a certified public accountant audit for 2024, and the agency
was cited for this rule violation during the current audit.
Staff Interviews
The Program Supervisor and Chief Administrators reported that they recently lost
their full time foster care worker and this has placed a burden on the supervisor
and one remaining staff. The Chief Administrator also announced that he is retiring
soon so the agency is pursuing a replacement for him.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in an older building in downtown Iron Mountain. There is
sufficient office space. CHRI documents are secured as required.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst generated two safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They
are as follows:
Safety Alert #1. A safety alert was generated on 2-11-2025 as the home did not
have smoke alarms between the child's bedroom and the rest of the home. There
was also no smoke alarm between the upstairs sleeping area and the rest of the
home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 02/13/2025 as fire alarms were installed
and photos provided.
Safety Alert #2. A safety alert was generated on 02/27/2025 as the home did not
have smoke alarms between the master bedroom and the rest of the home. In
addition, there was not a smoke alarm between the upstairs bedrooms and the rest of
the home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 03/06/2025 as alarms were installed and
photos provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
May 5, 2025
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 6, 2025
